attributes.action: Remove the proposed toll on the Balckwall tunnel starting in 2025
attributes.additional_details:
The Blackwall Tunnel a vital transport link in London has long stood as a crucial artery connecting the east and southeast with the rest of the city Its toll-free status is a testament to the principle of equitable access to urban infrastructure
West London boasts numerous free crossing options, alternatives ensure that residents and commuters have multiple routes without incurring extra costs In contrast, eastLondon faces limited options, making the tollfree Blackwall Tunnel a lifeline for many
attributes.background: Remove the proposed toll on the Balckwall tunnel starting in 2025 when the Silvertown tunnel is complete, there is no other options in that area to cross the river, in west London there are tens of bridges, in east London you only have the Blackwall tunnel.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. It is the responsibility of the Mayor of London and the London Assembly.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
